intro: Scholtzia subsessilis, commonly known as the slender scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States, particularly California. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is commonly referred to as the "ice plant" family. This species is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Scholtzia subsessilis is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
